headline: Slider-Style Mini Burgers
description: This slider recipe for mini baked burgers is made with a savory blend of ground beef, onion soup mix, mayo, and cheese that's great for potlucks.

video.description: Delectable tiny sliders great for a snack or appetizer!
video.name: Slider-Style Mini Burgers

name: Slider-Style Mini Burgers

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil and grease with cooking spray. Grease a sheet of aluminum foil; set aside.

Mix together ground beef and onion soup mix in a large skillet; cook and stir over medium-high heat until beef is crumbly and evenly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard any excess grease. Remove the skillet from heat; stir in Cheddar cheese and mayonnaise.
Place roll bottoms on the prepared baking sheet. Spread beef mixture onto each bottom. Cover with tops. Cover sandwiches with the prepared sheet of aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until burgers are heated through and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes. Serve with sliced pickles.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been making this one for years to rave reviews. Even with a small household of one adult and one kid, I make the full recipe and either freeze one of the foil-wrapped bundles in the roll tray or just bake it up a few days later. I tried it with the butter-flavored Hawaiian rolls and was surprised to find that the sweetness of the original-flavored ones is much preferred. There’s a little discrepancy in the onion soup mix amount. The recipe calls for 1.25 oz but currently the Lipton envelopes contain just under an ounce. The only reason I know that is bc I buy the mix in bulk and weigh it out for recipes. If I were using envelopes, I’d either open another and use some or all of it or supplement with some finely chopped or even dried onions as well as some onion powder.
Enjoyed these. Followed the recipe, very good. Thank you Minnesota Girl.

I've been making this recipe for years. Best ever!! The only thing I do differently is assemble the burgers, spray tops with butter flavored cooking spray, sprinkle a little garlic powder on top and wrap individually in foil and put them in the oven. I get people placing orders they love them so much.

I reduced the beef to 1 lb, as I didn't have enough buns. However, I didn't reduce the other ingredients. Very tasty and seasoned perfect. Personally, I think 2 lb of burger would lend to a bland taste.
Has become a family favorite!
I cut the recipe in half. it turned out perfect. grandkids and mom and dad loved it. gonna try with butterball ground turkey next time.

This recipe is good as is, but I kicked it up a couple of notches. I added an onion to the ground beef. I added 2T of Ketchup and 1T of mustard to the mayonnaise. After I put them together I melted a quarter cup of butter and brushed it over the tops of the rolls and then sprinkled sesame seeds over the tops of the rolls. Everything else I did according to the recipe. I will definitely make again.

I am mainly posting for the ingenious method. I made mine with ground turkey, a spoonful of onion soup, dash of Worcestershire sauce and Italian cheese mix, less mayo, but I wouldn't hesitate to try the beef version. A single widow, I made 1/2 batch and split it with my neighbors just because it was so intriguing.

Tasty. I cut the recipe in 1/2. I did use the whole packet of onion soup. I did follow the rest of the recipe as written. 
I gave a 4 because the bottom of the slider buns were hard. Next time I will only bake for 15minutes instead of 30. Yes, reminded us of White Castles, but so much better. We had 3 each.

These were so yummy and easy. I love that these aren't made with patties, yet they totally hold up in the little buns. Don't be afraid of the mayo; it really isn't overpowering and lends a richness to the meat mixture. I did use cookin4therapy's bun sauce, though I used less and wish I would have have slathered it on (especially on the insides of the bun). Fantastic recipe and so happy to have found it! It will be perfect to bring to a party! Bun sauce: 2 tbsp minced onion flakes, 1 tbsp worcestershire sauce, 1 tbsp Dijon or Spicy Mustard (not the regular yellow), 1/2 cup melted butter. You melt these together and brush on top of the buns just before you put in the oven to bake.
I followed the recipe, and they were okay. Not bad, not great.

My family loves this recipe. I always use the topping mixture in the review by cookin4therapy, really adds a lot of flavor. We try to watch our sodium levels and prepackaged soup mix has a lot. I use a homemade soup mix from this sight "Dry Onion Soup Mix" by Faye Watkins. I use HerbOx sodium free beef bouillon to make the onion soup mix and my family really enjoys these sliders.

Very easy and very good! I have learned to do the following: 1) I eliminate the cooking spray and use foil lined with parchment paper. 2) Cut the rolls apart prior to loading meat onto them, otherwise they are hard to pull apart and break.

This is a great recipe, so easy to make and such great flavors, I only made a half batch and that was plenty for the 4 of us with leftovers, I added some crumbled up bacon on top before baking, we will definitely be making these again

My husband has made these several times for our Bible Study group and they are definitely a FAVORITE! He’s had requests to bring them again! Perfect for any occasion, even a quick dinner during the week! Would recommend this recipe over and over! Thank you for sharing!
Enjoyed this. Used sub buns. Substituted sour cream for mayo.

I did made this back in May and I never had the chance to write a review for it. I made this as a new dinner recipe and for this having a lot of sliders to make, I'm surprised it was simple! Like always, my family enjoyed it and hopes I can make it again sometime lol! If your looking for a slider recipe that's both easy and quick, this will be the recipe I recommend!
Slider-Style Mini Burgers by Minnesota_Girl.
It was very tasty. My husband really enjoyed it. He gets a little nervous with new recipes that I try. This one was a hit.

I have been making this recipe for years and it is always a hit. For my latest endeavor I substituted the ground beef with Beyond Burger patties, as one of our party was vegetarian. I also did not have onion soup mix, so I substituted with a little garlic powder, dash of liquid smoke, a couple tsp of Worcester sauce, and diced onions cooked with the burgers which were broken up. I have to say they turned out terrifically and were a hit. I also use the butter/poppy seed/mustard et al topping mentioned in some other reviews. I would highly recommend using the Beyond Burger product as an alternative and healthier meat source for this recipe.
love love these sliders! so easy to make! worth the make
Excellent! Made exactly 24. Used Hawaiian sweet rolls..everyone loved! Great alternative to hamburgers on the grill for a summer meal.
Very delicious burgers and so easy to make. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
Great little burgers! Quick and easy to make and taste delicious.
My husband was telling me how unhealthy this is ....while finishing his 3rd burger. Spectacular recipe and super low effort. Loved it!

I absolutely love this recipe! However, I made some adjustments: 1) I only used one pound of ground beef, yet I still used a full pouch of “Beefy Onion” soup mix; 2) I halved the following: 1/2 cup mayo to 1/4 cup, the shredded cheddar from 2 cups to 1 cup and the Hawaiian sweet rolls from 24 to 12; and, 3) No pickles. So delicious! In fact, I’m going to make them for dinner tonight!
I use salt-free beef bullion and sauted chopped onions in place of the soup mix.

I did it how a reviewer suggested in the 13 by 9 baking pan and cut it in squares. I left out the mayo. Also, I quickly put the meat patties on the buns and placed them back into the bags. I closed them for a few minutes while preparing sides and the steam will soften the buns.
Freakin awesome!

These were just ok. The onion soup mix really added nothing to flavor these. I took another reviewers suggestion of topping these with the butter, dijon, minced onion, and worcestershire sauce. That alone is what gave this a slighly decent taste.
I followed the recipe exactly. My husband really liked them. First thing he said was, “are these White Castle burgers. “
I followed the recipe exactly. My husband really liked them. First thing he said was, “are these White Castle burgers. “

These were delicious! I used a little less mayo, and a little more cheese. And next time will do on soft dinner rolls. Used the kings hawaiian and they were too sweet. Also only baked 20 minutes. They would have burned at 30. And probably 15 would b better. Will definitely make again. Great recipe!

I was super excited to make these for a football party. Everyone said they tasted like White Castle ... I thought the flavor was a tad bland but not bad. I put a pickle on top of the meat and used slider buns. You could use about any flavor cheese - I’ll try pepper jack next time
Easy and delicious

These were a HUGE hit a t a potluck party I attended. I had run out of mayo so did not include it in the hamburger mixture. Also, prior to putting in the oven I drizzled mustard on the hamburger/cheese mix and layered the dill pickle chips . The party was for teenagers and they devoured them!

This was fantastic. No Changes at all. Made it for a bunch of 14 year old girls and my husband and son and daughter. No left overs. This was a fantastic New Year's Eve Dinner :) Thanks so much for sharing
This is the best recipe ever, simple to make . I used turkey and we loved it.
Easy and delicious! A great crowd-pleaser

Gave hubby this recipe, as he is home before me and usually cooks weekdays. These were so good. Like a White Castle but no cramps after..haha. I will surely have these again. He made fries to go with them.
No pickles as we ran out the day before we made them but they were still loved and enjoyed by the whole family....
I did less mayo (1/3 cup) and less cheese (1 cup) and it worked fine. However my cheese was a little bigger than regular shredded cheese so it might be around 1 and 1/2 cup!
Made these for my firehall they loved them!
Wow, this is really good. I fixed it for supper and my husband really liked it. I'll add this as something in my rotation. I usually change recipes or add something but this is great as it is.
Made these for three of us. Cut recipe in half. Only baked for 20 minutes. They were very good.

I added a 1/2 tsp of garlic powder to the meat mixture as well as 1/3c of mayo. Flattened out on a baking sheet and baked for 10min. Added chopped onions and baked for 10 more min then added cheese slices and baked for 5 more min. Placed meat patty on bottom buns added top then baked for 5 more min.

I always make a recipe the way it’s listed. Any changes are done later. To tell you the truth this was GREAT! I halved the recipe cause I had only 12 pack of Hawaiian rolls which I do not like. I made a mistake and put a whole envelope of onion soup mix. I thought it was going to be salty, nope it was ok. My husband loved them with pickles , corn on the cob and baked beans. I now will eat Hawaiian bread only with this recipe! Thanks Minnesota Girl for for the idea! And I don’t know what a White Castle taste like they don’t have them in California. Wish they did!

GREAT FOR CAMPING! I've been making this recipe for years and it's always good, I follow it exactly as written. But I wanted to share something I hadn't seen in the comments. We make this for camping!! I make the meat ahead of time and slice the bread. Then I spray some foil with a nonstick spray. Wrap the burgers in the foil and warm them over the campfire, or on a grill. Can't wait to take them camping tomorrow!
These were a big hit with our youth group at church. I made them exactly as the recipe says and wouldn't change a thing.

I followed the recipe & added in diced onions. We had dill spears on the side & used Kings Hawaiian rolls. They were perfect! My husband & I loved this & my 2yr olds liked it too. So easy to make. Thank you!

I halve the recipe, and don't add the cheese to the meat. I just prefer sliced american cheese on my burgers! This is a regular meal in our rotation. I definitely want to try experimenting more with it.
I make these, put them in sandwich bags, drop them in a couple gallon ziplock bags, and freeze them. They’re so nice to have on hand.
My husband and I absolutely loved and enjoyed these for dinner last night and they were better as left overs this morning.
Excellent! I made it per the recipe but added about five shakes of Worchestershire to the hamburger when I was browing it. SO delicious!
Good cheeseburgers. I made half the recipe with mini-buns. Also, I added bacon pieces. They taste like White Castle hamburgers.
5 star in hour house! A definite hit...we loved it!

My boyfriend loves these. I added the dehydrated onion soaked in water for a bit. They were fantastic. Will make these again. I picked up small brioche buns at Aldi. They were perfect size for these burgers

I thought these were ok , but not spectacular. My husband liked them more than I did. I used Hawaiian rolls and halved the recipe to make 12. Prepared as directed. Did put the pickle on the bun and pressed down the meat mixture which seemed to help the meat stay together more. I love White Castles and didn't think they tasted like them at all, so maybe that is my disappointment. They just needed something....

Only changed dry onion to a average sized yellow sweet onion, chopped, not minced. Served them on my homemade butter bun recipe I use for sandwich buns, but sized down the size. Big hit at the birthday party for adults and kids. Better than White Castle. I have enjoyed a few White Castles. Thank you for sharing. An Ex-Minnesotan, you betcha!
My step-son said these are even better than White Castle’s. Next time I’d reduce the onion mix by about half. Perfect with a little ketchup, mustard and pickle.

Well, two of the three; one said nothing, which is probably best. ;D Boychild, 21, said "fantastic" & Girlchild, 19, said "Good. Like Hamburger Helper, but better since homemade." I didn't know she'd had HH. Oh, well, she liked this. I used markdown labeled "hard dinner rolls," which I though may be too hard after buying. I often do the prep days ahead of the actual baking and serving... 
https://thepioneerwoman.com/cooking/freddys-burgers/ ... 3/7/20: Sixteen regularsized buns filled & half filling left. :o More buns next time - or less filling. :D

I made these yesterday for a party and they were a huge hit. My husband said they tasted like white castles. My husband loved them, so I didn't have the heart to tell him it included mayo which he hates. we will definately make these again.

I substituted ground turkey for ground beef and used a half packet of ranch dressing mix instead of onion mix and were such a hit with the kiddos! I used regular dinner rolls instead of the sweeter Hawaiian rolls to decrease the amount of sugar as well.

These are great little burgers. I used Miracle Whip instead of mayo because that's what I had on hand. The onion soup mix really adds flavor to these sliders, and saves time since you don't have to chop up raw onion. One of my kids didn't care for them, so they may not get made very often, but I, personally, enjoyed them a lot.
I love this recipe made it once, but it will be a regular bbn in our home.
I made it strictly by the recipe, but a few people commented that the onion soup mix gave them an odd flavor.
I split the recipe in half, and added American cheese to it. Really good!
Added diced bacon and served with pickles and mustard on the side. Seriously a hit for the Super Bowl crowd. Next time I will add more meat mixture to the buns, per request. This is a keeper!
Easy and so good! This will satisfy a Krystal craving for sure!
These were really good. I've made them for potlucks at my moms and superbowl snacks. They go every time!
Very easy to make. Taste great. Will make this again.
Kids devoured these! Made in brioche hot dog/hoagie buns, worked great. Did not use pickles.
Very easy to make came out great

HELPFUL TIP FOR ONION HATERS and those who don't want HARD buns: Really was kind of concerned my four kids would hate this because of the onion flavor. All of them despise onions, and you know what... I guess in this packet, it's not a standout because all of mine didn't say a thing. I noticed...but loved it! The only complaint they had was it needed more flavor in terms of ketchup and more pickles ...and the grownups wanted shredded lettuce and a tomato option. ……….BUT for a quick teenager snack that you can even make ahead and leave in a dish ready to just heat for 30 min, this definitely fits the bill. Also, was afraid of the 2lbs of ground beef.... I mean, that's a lot! ...but it really did well with 2 packs of king rolls. Sure there were leftovers, but it is worth eating again. I used enough buns that I thought the kids would eat. Foiled a 13X9 dish, and also covered with foil. W/O it, the buns would have been rocks. Also must cool ground beef as mentioned before adding the shredded cheese and mayo. Drain the beef too. All these made just the perfect burgers.
I make this recipe all I substitute ground venison this is my sons favorite recipe they ask it for all the time
Thought the flavor was bland. Will try adding more seasoning next time. Does not taste like white castles at all. We did eat them on regular buns like sloppy joes.
My very picky boyfriend loved this. I’ll keeo this in our familly favorites. The receipe is easy and tastes just as good when you cut it in half.

These are really good, but they were not exactly what I was looking for. I made some changes: I used the Hawaiian Sweet rolls, rather than plain dinner rolls. I didn't have onion soup mix, (frankly I don't care for it, and its very high in sodium, just fyi) So instead I added one fine chopped white onion, 1Tbsp. season salt, 2 tsp. black pepper, 2 tsp. garlic powder all added to meat mixture. I liked the alternate of cooking all in the frying pan to. But, if your looking for super thin burgers like the fast food (castle) you can also spread the meat mix thinly over a large cookie sheet, bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes, then using a couple pancake flippers, place onto your already prepared rolls. I wouldn't include pickles either. Put them
on the side. Anyone that dislikes pickles will hate the juice being all over your bread!
Easy to make. I used a bit of Whataburger creamy pepper sauce and shredded Monterrey jack to give it a kick. I kept the rolls on the Hawaiian tray (oven safe up to 350-deg) with nonstick foil on top.
Great recipes and easy to make. Only change I made was I used french onion soup mix.
You may wish you never let your friends know that you can make these !
I just made this for the first time and it's so good I made it just as it says I can't wait until my husband comes home from work and tries it
These are very easy to make, and they're a fairly cheap meal. Believe it or not they taste even better the next day. Just throw em in the microwave for about 30 seconds and yum!
Very salty. I halved all the salty ingredients ... mayo, onion packet, cheese... and it was still extremely salty. On the positive side, kids love it!
I stuck to the recipe, and I would definitely make them again. Everybody that ate ate these, including myself, said they were delicious.

I have made this many many times. I use the deli baked slider buns that are baked fresh every day. I have also substituted the fresh deli whole wheat hamburger buns and made these full size rather than slider size. They are a great meal and are quick and easy. They disappear quickly!
Very good. Especially for kids

An interesting note from me on this: I attempted to make these vegan by substituting ground beef for veggie ground, and mayonnaise for vegannaise. While I eventually goofed by buying regular dinner rolls (whoops, you kinda use milk to bake ...), this says nothing of how otherwise phenomenal these turned out. I had 4 people ask for the recipe at the potluck I made these for. Will absolutely be making them again for some week-long lunches~
Just wasn't a good fit for our family. Buns were too chewy , and the mixture was a bit dry.
I added 2 cups Chandra cheese,, onion dip mix and 4 Tablespoons of heavy cream
These turned out so good...better than White Crystal or Kristyl. Will definitely make again!
Yes! My husband loved them. Easy to make. Beats grilling burgers at the last minute.

I made these two weeks in a row. The first time was for a party and I made it exactly as the directions said. Everyone loved these. I made them again for just my family but halved the recipe. They are good reheated in the microwave as well.

These were so good! Taste a lot like White Castle. I halved the recipe, (just 2 of us at home) used ground turkey instead of beef, and skipped the pickles. But otherwise, followed the recipe exactly. I will definitely make these again!

I took the advice from the coworker who brought these in for a potluck. Brown the beef with BEEFY onion soup mix then drain and put in crockpot with cheese and mayo til melted. Serve with pickles and hawaiian buns. Soooo good and soooo easy!
Everyone loves these. I did not change a thing. Will feed a crowd.
These are amazing !! I made it tonight for my family of three and everyone loved it . They are so tasty and it's such an easy recipe . This recipe is a keeper forsure .
I thought this was so easy to make. I cut recipe in half for myself and my wife. They had a good flavor and would make again.
I didn’t have much hope for this recipe because it seemed too simple, but simple was just perfect! No changes made, but I did leave off the optional pickles.
